alert.note: Alert for St. Marys (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued May 09 at 3:17AM EDT until May 09 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Warning, up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, up to one half foot of inundation above ground level in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. For the Coastal Flood Watch, up to one foot of inundation above ground level possible in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in St. Marys County. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Warning, until 1 PM EDT this afternoon, especially around the time of high tide. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, until 4 AM EDT early this morning, especially around the time of high tide. For the Coastal Flood Watch, from 1 PM EDT this afternoon through late tonight, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...At 3.5 feet, water covers roads on Saint George Island, is in yards, and is approaching structures. To the east, inundation is occurring at multiple marinas off St. Mary`s River, Smith Creek, and Jutland Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides two to two and a half feet above normal. The next high tide at Point Lookout is at 8:16 AM and 9:03 PM. The next high tide at Piney Point is at 9:03 AM and 9:56 PM. The next high tide at Coltons Point is at 9:39 AM and 10:32 PM.
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
